title: Understanding Entropy Change in Gaseous Systems
text: Entropy is a measure of disorder in a system. When a gas is compressed without a temperature change, consider how the disorder of the gas molecules is affected.

title: Factors Affecting Entropy
text: Entropy tends to increase with volume increase, temperature increase, and when a substance transitions to a more disordered phase. Think about whether any of these conditions apply here.

title: Effect of Compression on Entropy
text: As carbon dioxide gas is compressed into a smaller volume without a change in temperature, does the entropy of the system increase, decrease, or remain unchanged?
